comment: Dr. Atkins teaches his course as you would be expected to perform in the real world. He outlines what he expects in the three written exams just like an employer would. The information required to answer the questions is difficult to source and requires diligent research. It's similar to what an employer would expect.

Prof. Atkins does everything in is power to make his job easy. His syllabus is very long and hes very particular on how he wants things done and if you dont do it, hes taking points off. If you are doing anything with Six Sigma - hes your only choice. The tests are impossible to find data on so prep days before.

I learned very little and what I did learn was on my own. This is not a class where Professor teaches, this is a class where you are told to go find the information yourself. There are only three grades and the instructions are very heavy on what font ect... but not much on what content should be. Exam questions are very difficult to find info on.
If you can write bs elaboratively, this is easy class to get an A. However, you are not going to learn anything from him.

I advise you to please listen to previous 1 star reviews, they have merit. 15 minute lectures maximum, asks for unreasonable Research Papers and will grade very harshly. I turned in about the same work as the "model paper" and got a 20. His lectures are useless and he does a great job at making you feel useless. 18 page syllabus if that says enough

Prof. Atkins is great as long as you are a self starter. He puts all of the lectures online (you HAVE to read them) and then you have a written exam (there are 3 in this class) over some of the chapters. If you read the materials and read the syllabus/expectations for the quizzes then this class is an easy A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Miserable teaching. Had him for twin classes in one semester and both classes only where composed of 3 test grades that take days to complete if you want to get an A. Very strict with sources and citing. I am an engineer already and I tried to explain although some things in the course where great in theory they werent always practical, lost 15 pt

I took this class later than I should have. If you do the work and READ the syllabus/instructions and FOLLOW them its an A in this class and the classes you will take with him in the future. If you want to work in the engineering field his classes are your ticket.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This course shouldn't have been this difficult, but Prof Atkins made it completely miserable. Entire course is 3 exams, each of which basically require a research project. Outside sources are mandatory, only mentioned in the syllabus. I had 15 points deducted on one question for only using the textbook as a source. Lectures were completely useless

Its true that he doesnt give you step by step instructions, he also does expect you to figure it out on your own BUT I asked questions and he explained it well. The few times he gave me the "Im not going to give you the answers" was when I had to put some effort in it. He wont baby you but he is extremely fair in his grading.

IET 4422 is when the monster in him comes out. 15min lectures max. Deducts points for items not covered. Doubts you as an engineer when asked q's, says q's are common sense. Clearly tenured. Do not show attitude or it will affect grades. Lots of panic attacks and breakdowns because of his mental rubric, adversarial attitude, and tough grading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof Atkins structures all of his courses by covering 1 module each week for the semester. He will lecture for about 15 minutes, then leave the rest for you to figure out. Asking questions is almost impossible. Very unhelpful. I strongly recommend taking the course elsewhere and transferring it in.

Reviewed this professor well in an earlier class but I now see what the complaints are about. For the big grade items in 4422 he deducted points for items he did not cover in lecture or instructions. Shirked responsibility for his own vague instructions when the lack of clarity was pointed out. Adversarial attitude towards students.

He lays out the course clearly, and you better hope you follow it well, because he will take points off for the smallest errors. Homework is not that difficult. His lectures are very short (no joke, 10 minutes on average) so do not miss anything he says. He does lack enthusiasm, and he is short and to the point. This is a double-edged sword.

Don't describe in your own words if they are not his words.  Literally wrote the exact same thing, just worded differently and was given a zero, more than once.   Any professor I've ever dealt with would give at least a point or something for turning in ANYTHING, not this guy, you get a zero if it doesn't match his EXACT words.

Do not take this professor. He doesn't care! Any Professor that does not care does not deserve to teach. He will not help you on your homework when you struggle. The class is pretty simple but he does the least amount of work he has to do and you have to fend for yourself. Any Professor would be better than this one

Pretty straight forward class.  Do the homework, do it well, and that's about it.  I took it online, homework was weekly and simple enough to do hours before the turn in date.  Optional final, one homework assignment dropped, ace all the homework, and you're golden.
Avoid at all costs for Engineering Economics this professor is the worst he does not teach, just preaches to the class in a monotone voice useless.

It is safe to say he does not waste your time. You will not be in his class for longer than 15 minutes. Each week you have a module assignment to complete. DO NOT ASK QUESTIONS IN HIS CLASS. He will shut you down. Hard grader but you do learn in his class. Just make sure you COMPLETELY follow the assignment directions and you will be fine.

Professor Atkins is a very fair but no-nonsense grader.  He is very knowledgeable about IE in both the classroom and in the real world and his classes are very informative.  He has zero patience for missed deadlines or abnormalities, but if you follow his syllabus he is VERY fair with grades.  His straightforward, no-gimmick classes are refreshing.

Robert Atkins, aka online as "GrandPappy" is a professor who will sabotage you if you don't agree with him or chuck and jive at his antics. If you take his class, keep all records of ANY assignment and email you have with him. This guy is a very disgusting and heartless professor. He also breaks many rules in his favor. Be very careful

he gives you the material you need via powerpoint. all he does is read the powerpoint to you, ask if you have questions, and then leaves. He isnt fond of helping students comprehend the information better but if you just teach your self and work with other students in the class you will be fine. he does grades strict some times but you can get an A

Easy class.  Show up to class you will hear the answers for some of the assignments.  Lectures are short less than 20 minutes.  It is imperative that you follow instructions.  If you can't do that then you won't do well in this class.  Final optional.  Don't spend your money on a book.

This professor is incredibly straightforward in his grading. If you miss points, it's because you didn't complete the assignment correctly. Late Assignments are penalized heavily 20 pts per day. He will not baby you, and is preparing you for a job!
He has the worst attitude. He doesn't like when students ask him a question. I am glad that I don't take any class with him.
He grades horribly. If you can get out of taking him make sure you do. He is arrogant and is mean and cold. Stay away!

This professor isn't really a professor. He is not helpful, or nice. I would hardly describe his attitude as abrasive, its moreso a "I dont't care if you pass, I get paid anyway" kind of attitude. This guy make the IE program as SPSU suck and lose reputation. If you can avoid him, do yourself and GPA a favor and avoid him like the plague.

Hey people! Wake up! This is rate your professor not rate your teacher! Professor Atkins gives you the material you need to make an A in the course. The "trick" to it is you need to actually read it and UNDERSTAND it. When you become an industrial engineer someday, your employer isn't going to coddle you if you are stuck. Atkins is preparing you.

In addition, the easiness is based on his lack of co-operation. The subject isn't hard, but since he doesn't teach, then it makes it tough. This guy is a no room for a single error kind of guy, not a reality kind of guy. Mr Atkins, please wake up and be a teacher. Anyone can tear students down.

AN orientation class with a 5 page research paper! Ridiculous.This professor will readily tell you, that he will not help you with your homework until after it has been graded. If you don't get how to do it from the examples he gives (without asking questions) then, tough. Only answers e-mails, doesn't want to be troubled with phone tag at all.

This professor gives you all of the information you need and doesn't waste time in class. I wish every professor was this organised and gave this much time for assignments -- we had the rest of the lab period as well as a whole week to complete the work! Unless you just cannot follow instructions there is no way you could get anything less than an A!

Stop giving Atkins a hard time, this is engineering people. He is an excellent professor and really knows his stuff. Work I've learned in his class I have already used on the job interning. He's very straight forward and doesn't waste your time. NO BOOK EITHER!

His way or the highway. Take it or leave it. You can actually hear it when he speaks as he speaks with some sort of arrogance. He doesn't curve even if you are at 89%. If u r 1 minute late to submit ur work, that means 20 pts deduction.
Mono-tone. Boring. One of the main reasons for changing my major, but that might be a good thing.

Straightforward teaching style.  No wasted time teaching you anything you do not need to know.  If you turn in anything late, huge deduction, so get it done and submitted on time.  If you do the assignments on time and you pay attention to his short powerpoint lectures and you can write essay's reasonably well, you should get a good grade.

Be prepared for him to be vague. It is true that if you ask him a question he will be vague as possible because he doesn't want to make work easy but doesn't hesitate to deduct points for not reading his mind.

He is a great professor and knows his stuff.  Unfortunately he does like to share his knowledge.  I made a grade higher than I though I would..Just remember, anything you ask is part of your assignment and he will not help.  If you turn in anything late.It a huge deduction  20 points.  Does not go over homework..Your okay if your as smart as he is
Excellent professor, very clear and knows his stuff. Does not waste class time. Follow instructions and you can make an A easy.

Had him for a summer quality concepts class. He does not use the book just stands in front a recites definitions like he is preaching or something. He is not helpful and tests are weighed to heavily. Do not take him you will regret it.
I hate this professor, this course is not suppose to be hard. However, if he doesn't like you, he will eventually grade harder on your exams...
good prof.

Atkins is a pedagogue. He will not get to know you and seems annoyed to be here. Part of the purpose of this class should have been to teach what the different IET professions are, but he did not. Do not purchase the textbook before class because he will probably not use it. I got an A in this class, but I do not recommend this teacher.

PROS: Clear and thorough lecturer; Very organized and structured; Wealth of actual industry experience; Attendance optional; Did not collect homework; Only held class one day a week instead of two; Easy grader. CONS: Lacks personality; Had no interest to get to know students

Aw, if only every teacher could be like Professor Atkins. Organized, pleasant, & to the point. I loved both classes I took with him (work measurement, plant layout). He printed up excerpts from both the textbook and his lecture notes that were relevant. I recommend him highly.
Straight to the point. Does not waste time on usless information. Good teacher. NEVER miss a lab!
